titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lydia E. Hollingsworth Letters 1839-1840 and undated.
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters to Hollingsworth from family members in Hagerstown, Maryland. The letters concern news of family and friends in Maryland, parental advice to their student daughter, and a description of her sister's work in school.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Lydia E. Hollingsworth letters 1839-1840 and undated., David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Lydia E. Hollingsworth was a Catholic student at St. Joseph's College in Emmitsburg, Maryland.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters to Hollingsworth from family members in Hagerstown, Maryland. The letters concern news of family and friends in Maryland, parental advice to their student daughter, and a description of her sister's work in school.
